meanings.definition: To surpass in juggling skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: She outjuggled all her friends at the juggling competition.
meanings.sent2: The professional juggler outjuggled the amateur with ease.
meanings.sent3: The clown outjuggled the magician in a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: He outjuggled his own record, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The circus performer outjuggled everyone with their incredible speed and precision.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: In the chess match, he outjuggled his opponent with a clever move.
meanings.sent2: The detective outjuggled the criminal by solving the case quickly.
meanings.sent3: The student outjuggled the teacher by finding a loophole in the rules.
meanings.sent4: She outjuggled her rivals by coming up with a brilliant strategy.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outjuggled the competition by training harder than anyone else.
